Articles.Content:
So I admit that I've only spent about a half hour with the new update so far, and whilst I haven't dug into the deeper contract yet of course I do have a less than stellar impression of the early stages. Currently I have only done two launches yet my finance has already increased sevenfold. I'm getting the feeling that it may soon lead to endlessly increasing these numbers in a meaningless way since it appears managing my cash flow or reputation may not even be on the priority list. I hope I'm wrong but I've hardly touched it and I'm well on my way to 100k already!

The challenges themselves add a new depth however and it's fun to have meaning to my launches, however finance has already raised an eyebrow that I will be keeping track of to see how easily money can be gained.

Well, if you think you have too much funds then you can always do off-mission launches with goofy inventions, or space stations
SRB's work underwater.... good to know.

I dug through the notes but didn't see some of the changes mentioned by the devs as being worked on, so I thought I would ask:

Were the joints fixed so they don't fall apart or pancake when transferring in and out of time warp?

Was the SAS induced wobbling on large long crafts fixed?

Did struts actually get two end points now?

Were external command seats fixed to not permanently break Kerbals when they fall out?

Is the orbit calculated from the center of mass yet, so that it doesnt wobble around on the map screen?

Was the maneuver system improved at all? (considering the predictions still disappears and glitches out 50% of time)

overall thanks for the massive update. I hope it doesn't crash, because I still don't play single player games that crash.

At 96% of the way into the download, the download failed. Now it won't let me start again.

I'm quite literally crying right now.

WHY?! WHAT HAVE I DONE WRONG?!

Just wondering (Kasper if you still here) has squad ever thought about doing a torrent link in the store? (only available once you logged in) - that way at least your servers wouldn't go into meltdown..

We haven't, but I'll bring it up to the rest of the team.
I'm kind of sad now. The 0.24 hypetrain was the most amazing thread I've ever seen
Can anyone point me to the x64 release on steam? I can't find it

KSP download page blank under Opera

KSP download page blank under Chrome

KSP download page blank under Firefox

"Would you like to save or open this file" Under IE

Well....that was unexpected....IE came through for once.

I'm kind of sad now. The 0.24 hypetrain was the most amazing thread I've ever seen

Yeah, setting records on page numbers... oh well. Maybe the 0.25 update will surpass it
"KSP couldn't be downloaded. Retry?" link click count: 79
Is there any way the mods/OP could reformat the top post here so I can actually read it on a phone? I feel like someone put too many HTML tags in and not enough BBCode...
Keep up the amazing work squad
Brilliant guys

Can anyone point me to the x64 release on steam? I can't find it

C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\SteamApps\Common\Kerbal Space Program\KSP_x64.exe (it's not a separate install)

They definitely were

A full changelog is in the first post of this thread

About that, I'm getting some clipping and don't think I can see everything.

https://www.dropbox.com/s/v8dv5px5qy717ed/Screenshot%202014-07-17%2020.22.49.png

Can anyone point me to the x64 release on steam? I can't find it

x64 and x86 executables are both downloaded. You can launch x64 manually from the game's install directory.

EDIT: Ninja'd
I miss the #HypeTrain =,(
I'm getting HTTP 403 errors now. Have I tried to download too many times? (Overall download-link-click count: 214, plus or minus 3)

About that, I'm getting some clipping and don't think I can see everything.

https://www.dropbox.com/s/v8dv5px5qy717ed/Screenshot%202014-07-17%2020.22.49.png

I'm aware of that, will have to rework the template for the opening post for the next update. The changelog is also available in the readme.txt that comes with 0.24 and through an article on the main page
Screw this, I'm removing all mods. Something will go wrong if I don't.

Screw this, I'm removing all mods. Something will go wrong if I don't.

My thoughts as well, but playing without FAR or Deadly Reentry just... isn't it.
Thanks Squad for yet another great job. Finally got it off the site and it only took 40 minutes, when I started the download its said 3 days 5 hours to completion .
Yay! Steam updated me double quick! Now running v0.24.0.0 ... First Contract. So let's fire this thing up and see what happens ...

- Gimballing Engines now respond to roll input.

- 4x Engine Cluster and RAPIER Engine have gimbal roll authority even if stacked over the centerline (due to multiple nozzles).

First reaction: And how would that work??

Then: Ah, OK, go on.

- Improved logic for detecting a vessel in 'orbiting' situations.

Dipping into atmosphere to take readings now works without establishing a suborbital flight path?
If I switch to Steam, can I still use mods normally?
